div.p: The Variation profile defines a structured approach for representing genetic variations at specific genomic loci. It characterizes the genetic composition at a given location in three distinct states: context, reference, and alternative. This profile leverages MolecularDefinition resource to enable precise communication of genetic alterations. Where applicable, the Variation profile can integrate Sequence and Allele profiles to provide a comprehensive representation of genomic changes, supporting interoperability in health information systems.
